main event: On 3 April 1952, several witnesses observed a silvery, disc-like object hovering in the sky over Benson, Arizona for approximately 52 minutes.
interesting points: The object was observed by multiple Air Force pilots and cadets who were in the area., The object did not change size, position, or intensity during the entire observation period., One witness made a fix on the object at an elevation of 25 degrees., The object was first seen appearing like a bright star, noticeable enough to not require scanning to locate it., The sighting was documented with thorough reporting, eliminating potential balloon explanations but leaving other conventional explanations open.
witness description: Air Force pilots and cadets from Marana Air Base
